Apollo 14 artwork
S-1C booster stage for Apollo 14 Saturn V being hoisted into High Bay 3 for erection on the mobile launcher in the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASA Spaceport.
Apollo 14 spacecraft undergoes docking probe checks
Descent stage of lunar module for Apollo 14 lowered into vacuum chamber for tests.
Astronaut Alan Shepard using MET during geological training in Mexico
Apollo 14 backup crew (Cernan & Engle) during geology training
Apollo 14 backup crew during geology training
Apollo 14 backup crew during geology training
Apollo 14 backup crew during geology training
Apollo 14 backup crewmembers Gene Cernan and Joe Engle participating in geological and lunar surface simulation training in Pinacate volcanic area of northwestern Sonora, MX.
Apollo 14 backup crewmembers Gene Cernan and Joe Engle participating in geological and lunar surface simulation training in Pinacate volcanic area of northwestern Sonora, MX.
Apollo 14 prime and backup crew survey vent area where eruptions occurred in early spring of 1970.
Alan Shepard and Ed Mitchell during geology/EVA training
Astronaut Alan Shepard uses trenching tool during simulation of lunar surface
Apollo 14 commander Alan Shepard, front, and Edgar Mitchell, lunar module pilot, riding on specially-designed electrical vehicle en route from astronaut suiting room to altitude chamber.
Alan Shepard prepares to enter the LM in the altitude chamber at KSC for a simulated exercise prior to actual altitude runs
Apollo 14 command module pilot Stuart A. Roosa prepares for altitude chamber test at KSC.
Apollo 14 Back-Up LMP Joe Engle prepares for a CM altitude chamber run at KSC.
Apollo 14 Back-Up CMP Ron Evans prepares to participate in an altitude chamber run at KSC
fisheye view of Shepard and Mitchell during LM training
the Apollo 14 crew in the CM during training
Apollo 14 crew Alan Shepard (bottom), Stuart Roosa and Edgar Mitchell (top)
Astronaut Alan Shepard, Commander of the Apollo 14 lunar landing mission, is shown here during a simulated extra-vehicular activity in the Flight Crew Training Building at Kennedy Space Center.

Astronaut Alan Shepard, Commander of the Apollo 14 lunar landing mission, is shown here involved in final suiting up operations prior to the simulated extra-vehicular activity in the Flight Crew Training Building at Kennedy Space Center
Alan Shepard in the CM simulator
closeup of Alan Shepard during EVA training
Astronaut Alan B. Shepard during lunar surface training at KSC
Astronauts Mitchell and Shepard during lunar surface training at KSC
Alan Shepard photographs Ed Mitchell beside the U.S. flag during EVA training in Houston
Alan Shepard pulls the MET during EVA training
Apollo 14 commander Alan Shepard during EVA training
Apollo 14 astronaut Alan B. Shepard, Jr., wearing extravehicular mobility unit (EMU) checks lunar geological exploration camera at Kennedy Space Center.
Apollo 14 Lunar Module during checkout
Shepard is pictured with equipment at the Modular Equipment Transporter area on the LM during EVA simulation at KSC
Apollo 14 CMP Stuart Roosa listns to a question during a press conference at MSC
The Apollo 14 S-II stage is moved to the Vehicle Assembly Building
Apollo 14 backup crewmembers Gene Cernan and Joe Engle during EVA simulation with mortar and seismic recorder/relay equipment
closeup of Apollo 14 backup astronaut Joe Engle during EVA training
Apollo 14 Astronaut Alan B. Shepard, Jr, commander, participating in lunar surface simulation training at Kennedy Space Center with modular equipment transporter.
Apollo 14 crew training

a technician assists Alan Shepard suiting up for lunar surface simulation training at KSC
Astronaut Edgar D. Mitchell participates in lunar surface simulation training at KSC
Mitchell (left) and Shepard (right) during EVA training activities at Kennedy Space Center
Lunar surface simulation training
Apollo 14 Astronaut Alan B. Shepard, Jr, commander, holding U.S. flag, suited up for lunar surface simulation training at Kennedy Space Center.
Shepard prepares to deploy lunar surface television camera during EVA training activities at KSC
Apollo 14 Astronaut Edgar D. Mitchell, lunar module pilot, participates in lunar surface simulation training at Kennedy Space Center attached to a six degrees of freedom simulator.
Shepard during EVA training at KSC
Shepard training with MET at KSC
Mitchell during EVA training at KSC
Alan Shepard at MSC press conference
Gene Cernan, backup commander for Apollo 14, suits up for an EVA simulation
Apollo 14 astronaut, backup lunar module pilot, Joe Engle, suited up for simulation of EVA.
Astronauts Shepard and Mitchell suited up for altitude tests
Alan Shepard watches as Ed Mitchell descends from the Lunar Module during EVA training
Apollo 14 LM checkout at KSC (Apollo 15 LM-10 in background)
Mitchell demonstrates Modular Equipment Transporter to be used on Apollo 14 mission
Two members of Apollo 14 prime crew relax aboard Retriever prior to water egress training in Gulf of Mexico
Shepard trains with a mock-up of the Lunar surface TV camera while aboard a KC-135 aircraft
Shepard works with a training model of the MET while aboard a KC-135 aircraft
Shepard training aboard KC-135
Edgar Mitchell works with camera equipment while training abaord a KC-135
Shepard and Mitchell work with a MET trainer aboard a KC-13
Close-up of Mitchell pulling a training version of the MET while aboard a KC-135
The Apollo 14 adapter stage is lowered into place
The Apollo 14 CSM  undergoes final checks in the Manned Spacecraft Operations Building at KSC prior to mating with the Spacecraft-Lunar Module Adapter (SLA)
Apollo 14 spacecraft being stacked in the VAB
Apollo 14 command and service modules being mated to the spacecraft LM adapter.
Apollo 14 CSM enclosed in a thermo cover is being mated to launch vehicle
Alan Shepard practices with MET in zero-gravity training aircraft
Alan Shepard pulls the Modular Equipment Transporter under weightless conditions aboard an Air Force KC-135 out of Patrick Air Foce Base

The Apollo 14 begins its rollout from the VAB
Apollo 14 rollout viewed from VAB roof
Apollo 14 shortly after rollout from VAB.  Note that the lightning mast is only partially deployed.

Apollo 14 rollout
Apollo 14 astronauts Edgar D. Mitchell, Alan B. Shepard, Jr. and Stuart A. Roosa pose while their Saturn V space vehicle rolls out to pad 39-A
Apollo 14 crew members and KSC officials attend the rollout of their Saturn V
Apollo 14 Saturn 5 rollout to Pad 39A
Apollo 14 astronauts, l-r, Edgar D. Mitchell, Alan B. Shepard, Jr., and Stuart A. Roosa during rollout of the Saturn-5 launch vehicle.
Apollo 14 rollout - Saturn V is approaching the MSS parking site
Apollo 14 Saturn V on pad A incline during rollout

Astronaut Alan Shepard leads the Apollo 14 crew back across swing arm 9 after inspecting the Command Module during the Saturn V rollout

Apollo 14 astronauts, Lunar Module Pilot Edgar Mitchell and Commander Alan Shepard, are in the cabin of the crawler transporter as the  363-foot-high space vehicle sits  on top the crawler during the rollout of the vehicle to Launch Pad 39A

Apollo 14 water egress training, l-r, Alan B. Shepard, Jr., commander; Stuart A. Roosa, command module pilot; and Edgar D. Mitchell, lunar module pilot.

Apollo 14 backup crew with nurse Dee O'Hara before undergoing preflight physicals at KSC

Apollo 14 backup commander Eugene Cernan, left, pauses in front of astronaut crew quarters as Kennedy Space Center security officer Dearmond Matthews prepares to open the door to the quarantined area.
Apollo 14 backup pilot Ronald Evans prepares to practice flying skills in jet aircraft.
The crew of Apollo 14 during a pre-flight meeting
Apollo 14 commander Alan Shepard poses on steps of the Lunar Module Simulator at the Kennedy Space Center.
Apollo 14 - Edgar Mitchell, Alan Shepard, and Stuart Roosa prepare to practice their upcoming lunar mission in spacecraft simulators at the Kennedy Space Center.

The Apollo 14 prime crew relax in their Spaceport and reviewed the flight plan for their voyage to the moon. Pictured are Stuart A. Roosa, command module pilot; Alan B. Shepard, Jr., mission commander; and Edgar D. Mitchell, lunar module pilot.
Apollo 14 astronaut Stuart Roosa prepared to take off in a T-38 aircraft to practice flying skills
Apollo 14 Mission Commander Alan Shepard gestures to ground personnel that he is ready to take his T-38 aircraft on a training flight
Apollo 14 astronaut Edgar Mitchell signs an autograph for a well-wisher prior to practicing his flying skills in a T-38 aircraft
Apollo 14 CSM at night during MSS rollback prior to launch

The Apollo 14 prime crew relax in their Spaceport and reviewed the flight plan for their voyage to the moon. Pictured are Stuart A. Roosa, command module pilot; Alan B. Shepard, Jr., mission commander; and Edgar D. Mitchell, lunar module pilot

The Apollo 14 crewmen step aboard the U.S.S. New Orleans, after exiting a U.S. Navy helicopter which retrieved the three from their splashdown site
